intro: Scaphyglottis albida, commonly known as the white scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features striking white petals and a unique, spurred labellum that distinguishes it from other orchid species. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from the rich, organic soil of its natural habitat. Scaphyglottis albida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant floral display.
